title: User Authentication and Security Setup
summary: Implement secure user login with multi-factor authentication and encryption.
description: Develop and implement a secure authentication mechanism allowing users to sign in using unique credentials combined with multi-factor authentication (MFA). This includes encryption of sensitive data, session management, and compliance with banking security standards to safeguard user information and prevent unauthorized access.

title: Core User Dashboard Development
summary: Create a personalized dashboard displaying banking products and services.
description: Design and build a user-friendly, personalized dashboard that displays all relevant banking products, services, and account information based on each user's profile and eligibility. This dashboard will serve as the central hub for all user interactions, providing quick access to key features and data visualizations for an optimal user experience.

title: Responsive UI/UX Design and Accessibility
summary: Develop a responsive and consistent interface across devices.
description: Develop an adaptive, responsive interface that provides a seamless user experience on desktop, tablet, and mobile platforms. Ensure that the design adheres to accessibility standards and delivers an intuitive layout that simplifies navigation and interaction for all user types.

title: Account Opening and Service Modification Workflows
summary: Enable users to submit new account requests and service modifications.
description: Implement streamlined digital workflows that allow users to submit new account opening requests and modify existing services. These workflows should be designed for minimal clicks and maximum efficiency, guiding users through simple steps with validation checks and dynamic forms. Integration with back-office approval systems must be included.

title: Document Management and Upload Feature
summary: Develop secure document upload and management functionality.
description: Enable users to securely upload and manage required documentation through the interface for processes such as account opening or service modification. Implement a robust file validation, versioning, and storage mechanism ensuring data is encrypted and accessible only to authorized users.

title: Real-Time Notifications and Status Tracking
summary: Provide real-time updates and email notifications for user requests.
description: Implement a system for real-time status tracking of user-submitted requests, coupled with automated email and in-portal notifications. This ensures users receive timely updates on their requests’ progress, enhancing transparency and engagement while reducing support inquiries.

title: Interaction History and Audit Trail
summary: Maintain comprehensive records of user activities and submissions.
description: Develop a comprehensive audit trail that logs all user interactions and transaction activities within the portal. The history should be easily accessible for users to review their past requests and actions, while also supporting compliance and internal auditing requirements.

title: Core Banking System Integration
summary: Integrate the portal with the existing core banking infrastructure.
description: Establish seamless integration between the self-service portal and the bank’s existing core banking system, enabling real-time data synchronization, account updates, and transaction processing. This integration ensures that users can securely perform operations without data inconsistency or performance issues.

title: Portal Database Management and Optimization
summary: Design an independent database to enhance performance and reliability.
description: Develop and maintain a dedicated database structure to support the portal’s operations, caching, and data retrieval processes. This database will operate independently to ensure high performance, fault tolerance, and data integrity while interfacing with the core banking system as needed for synchronization.

title: Role-Based Access Control Implementation
summary: Implement granular access control based on user roles and permissions.
description: Introduce a role-based access control (RBAC) system that restricts access to services, features, and data based on user authorization levels and profiles. This ensures compliance with security policies and prevents unauthorized viewing or modification of sensitive financial information.
